sentences.chinese: 宰制萬物，役使群眾，豈人力也哉？
sentences.literal: To control all things and employ the multitudes, how can this be done by human strength alone?

sentences.chinese: 余至大行禮官，觀三代損益，乃知緣人情而制禮，依人性而作儀，其所由來尚矣。
sentences.literal: I came to the Grand Ceremonial Office and observed the gains and losses of the Three Dynasties, and thus knew that rites are established according to human feelings, and ceremonies are made according to human nature—their origins are ancient indeed.

sentences.chinese: 人道經緯萬端，規矩無所不貫，誘進以仁義，束縛以刑罰，故德厚者位尊，祿重者寵榮，所以總一海內而整齊萬民也。
sentences.literal: Human affairs have myriad aspects, yet regulations must penetrate everything. People are guided forward with benevolence and righteousness, restrained with punishments. Thus those with profound virtue receive honored positions; those with heavy merit receive glorious rewards. This serves to unify the empire and regulate the myriad people.

sentences.chinese: 口甘五味，為之庶羞酸咸以致其美；
sentences.literal: The mouth delights in the five flavors, so many delicacies of sour and salty are prepared to bring out their excellence;

sentences.chinese: 情好珍善，為之琢磨圭璧以通其意。
sentences.literal: The emotions delight in treasures and goodness, so jade disks are polished to communicate their intentions.

sentences.chinese: 故大路越席，皮弁布裳，朱弦洞越，大羹玄酒，所以防其淫侈，救其彫敝。
sentences.literal: Therefore the great chariot and reed mat, the leather bonnet and cloth robe, the vermilion strings and penetrating tones, the great broth and plain wine—these all serve to prevent licentious extravagance and save from decay.

sentences.chinese: 是以君臣朝廷尊卑貴賤之序，下及黎庶車輿衣服宮室飲食嫁娶喪祭之分，事有宜適，物有節文。
sentences.literal: Thus the order of ruler and minister, court and official, honored and humble, noble and base—extending down to the common people with their carriages and clothing, palaces and chambers, food and drink, marriage and burial, mourning and sacrifice—each matter has what is suitable, each thing has its regulated form.

sentences.chinese: 循法守正者見侮於世，奢溢僭差者謂之顯榮。
sentences.literal: Those who follow the law and maintain uprightness are insulted by the world, those who are extravagant and presumptuous are called glorious.

sentences.chinese: 孝景用其計，而六國畔逆，以錯首名，天子誅錯以解難。
sentences.literal: Emperor Jing used his plans, and the six states rebelled, taking Cuo's head as a name, the Son of Heaven executed Cuo to resolve the difficulty.

sentences.chinese: 是後官者養交安祿而已，莫敢復議。
sentences.literal: After this, officials fostered connections and secured salaries only, none dared discuss again.

sentences.chinese: 今上即位，招致儒術之士，令共定儀，十餘年不就。
sentences.literal: Some say that in ancient times when there was great peace, the myriad people were happy and joyful, auspicious responses clearly arrived, thus they collected customs and established institutions.

sentences.chinese: 或言古者太平，萬民和喜，瑞應辨至，乃采風俗，定制作。
sentences.literal: Some say that in ancient times when there was great peace, the myriad people were happy and joyful, auspicious responses clearly arrived, thus they collected customs and established institutions.

sentences.chinese: 禮由人起。
sentences.literal: Rites arise from people.

sentences.chinese: 故禮者養也。
sentences.literal: Thus rites are nourishment.

sentences.chinese: 稻粱五味，所以養口也；
sentences.literal: Rice and millet, the five flavors—these nourish the mouth;

sentences.chinese: 鐘鼓管弦，所以養耳也；
sentences.literal: Bells and drums, pipes and strings—these nourish the ears;

sentences.chinese: 君子既得其養，又好其辨也。
sentences.literal: Palaces, chambers, curtains, tents, vessels, and dishes are to people as guiding principles and legal standards are to people.

sentences.chinese: 孰知夫［士］出死要節之所以養生也。
sentences.literal: Who understands that scholars risking death to maintain integrity is the way to nourish life?

sentences.chinese: 孰知夫輕費用之所以養財也，孰知夫恭敬辭讓之所以養安也，孰知夫禮義文理之所以養情也。
sentences.literal: Who understands that frugal expenditure is the way to nourish wealth? Who understands that respectful yielding is the way to nourish security? Who understands that rites, righteousness, patterns, and principles are the way to nourish the emotions?

sentences.chinese: 情勝之為安，若者必滅。
sentences.literal: If they regard emotional indulgence as security, they will certainly perish.

sentences.chinese: 一之於情性，則兩失之矣。
sentences.literal: Those who cultivate themselves suffer from not knowing their emotions and nature;

sentences.chinese: 故儒者將使人兩得之者也，墨者將使人兩失之者也。
sentences.literal: Those who govern their families suffer from not knowing ritual propriety;

sentences.chinese: 是儒墨之分。
sentences.literal: As for rites, they are the source from which prohibitions against chaos arise,

sentences.chinese: 治辨之極也，彊固之本也，威行之道也，功名之總也。
sentences.literal: Emotions and nature are what determine movement and stillness;

sentences.chinese: 弗由之，所以捐社稷也。
sentences.literal: Rites and righteousness are what regulate emotions and nature;

sentences.chinese: 故堅革利兵不足以為勝，高城深池不足以為固，嚴令繁刑不足以為威。
sentences.literal: Those who are regulated by rites are those who follow their true emotions;

sentences.chinese: 由其道則行，不由其道則廢。
sentences.literal: Those who are not regulated by rites are those who pursue their emotions.

sentences.chinese: 宛之鉅鐵施，鉆如蜂蠆，輕利剽遫，卒如熛風。
sentences.literal: As for the remaining patterns, righteousness, emotions, and appearances, there must be something that can be discussed about them.

sentences.chinese: 莊蹻起，楚分而為四參。
sentences.literal: Those who are rulers grasp the root and control the branches;

sentences.chinese: 其所以統之者非其道故也。
sentences.literal: This is why rites flourish.

sentences.chinese: 汝潁以為險，江漢以為池，阻之以鄧林，緣之以方城。
sentences.literal: Thus rites are the root;

sentences.chinese: 然而秦師至鄢郢，舉若振槁。
sentences.literal: Rulers serve the root;

sentences.chinese: 其所以統之者非其道故也。
sentences.literal: Loyalty and trustworthiness are the root of rites;

sentences.chinese: 紂剖比干，囚箕子，為炮格，刑殺無辜，時臣下懔然，莫必其命。
sentences.literal: Honor and humility are the order of rites;

sentences.chinese: 然而周師至，而令不行乎下，不能用其民。
sentences.literal: This is why rites are practiced.

sentences.chinese: 其所以統之者非其道故也。
sentences.literal: Root and branches are what strengthen rites.

sentences.chinese: 有不由命者，然後俟之以刑，則民知罪矣。
sentences.literal: Who knows that light expenditure is the means to nourish wealth, who knows that respectful yielding is the means to nourish security, who knows that rites righteousness pattern principle is the means to nourish emotion.

sentences.chinese: 故刑一人而天下服。
sentences.literal: People if living as their view, those will certainly die;

sentences.chinese: 罪人不尤其上，知罪之在己也。
sentences.literal: If profit as their view, those will certainly harm;

sentences.chinese: 是故刑罰省而威行如流，無他故焉，由其道故也。
sentences.literal: If laziness as security, those will certainly danger;

sentences.chinese: 故由其道則行，不由其道則廢。
sentences.literal: If emotion prevailing as security, those will certainly perish.

sentences.chinese: 古者帝堯之治天下也，蓋殺一人刑二人而天下治。
sentences.literal: Thus those who govern the state suffer from not knowing rites and righteousness;

sentences.chinese: 君師者，治之本也。
sentences.literal: Emotions and nature are what determine movement and stillness;

sentences.chinese: 三者偏亡，則無安人。
sentences.literal: Those who are not regulated by rites are those who pursue their emotions.

sentences.chinese: 故王者天太祖，諸侯不敢懷，大夫士有常宗，所以辨貴賤。
sentences.literal: As for the remaining patterns, righteousness, emotions, and appearances, there must be something that can be discussed about them.

sentences.chinese: 貴賤治，得之本也。
sentences.literal: Rites are what the ruler establishes;

sentences.chinese: 郊疇乎天子，社至乎諸侯，函及士大夫，所以辨尊者事尊，卑者事卑，宜鉅者鉅，宜小者小。
sentences.literal: Those who are rulers grasp the root and control the branches;

sentences.chinese: 故有天下者事七世，有一國者事五世，有五乘之地者事三世，有三乘之地者事二世，有特牲而食者不得立宗廟，所以辨積厚者流澤廣，積薄者流澤狹也。
sentences.literal: Those who are ministers grasp the branches and serve the root.

sentences.chinese: 貴本之謂文，親用之謂理，兩者合而成文，以歸太一，是謂大隆。
sentences.literal: Rulers serve the root;

sentences.chinese: 利爵弗啐也，成事俎弗嘗也，三侑之弗食也。
sentences.literal: Loyalty and trustworthiness are the root of rites;
